Posts.Content: grahaad1 wrote: I have recently joined the stage IV club. I like my local oncologist and would like to receive as much treatment locally as possible, but I want to find an oncologist to be my second opinion. Anyone have recommendations on the top oncologists in the US for my situation (stage 4, triple negative, age 32)? I am willing to travel and seek out the best so I would love to hear your recommendations! Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2015 04:50PM grahaad1 wrote: Anyone having issues on Halaven with low counts? I have completed two cycles ( 4 treatments). Last treatment was March 13 (last week was off week) and today my ANC was around 250. I am getting 3 shots of neupogen before treatment Friday.
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2015 08:55PM grahaad1 wrote: SyrMom -It does cause bone pain but the Claritin seems to help. I try to rest when I can but with 2 little ones and a full time job it can be difficult :) The low counts and thinning hair are my only side effects so I cant complain too much!
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2015 02:53AM grahaad1 wrote: SyrMom - I haven't had a any issues with mouth sores. Hope your counts hold up for treatment! My onc thinks I'll be getting Neupogen from here on out to keep me on track.
